page.title: 07Education-Luffenham & Weston
page.content: There are two schools in our area. One is the Edith Weston C.P.This school has 149 pupils. The number fluctuates because it mainly accommodates children of R.A.F. North Luffenham. The other school is North Luffenham C.of E. This school was opened in 1969 to accommodate children from North Luffenham, Barrowden, South Luffenham and Morcott. In 1967 these four villages had their own Primary schools. The children attending the present North Luffenham School are North Luffenham 51, South Luffenham 32, Barrowden 48, Morcott 16 and other villages 4. Two buses are provided each day, one bringing children from South Luffenham and Morcott, the other from Barrowden. Midday meals are provided at school.Of the 151 children, 2 go home, 105 have a school meal and 46 bring sandwiches.
